intro: Malvastrum peruvianum var. elongatum, commonly known as the Peruvian mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its elongated, hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to white. Its leaves are typically lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats.
